overview:
Rob spends his days ensuring a superlative member experience and acquiring shiny, happy members for Limbo.

Before Limbo, Rob was a co-founder of Enpocket, a global mobile marketing firm that represented brand-name clients such as Fox TV, TBS, Levi’s, and Reebok. There, Rob was responsible for U.S. operations and for the development of Enpocket’s data and research services. Additionally, he worked with broadcasters, operators, advertisers, and agencies to understand how and why mobile marketing works for their brands, as well as how this marketing could be improved.

Previously Rob was European research director for Engage from 1999 to 2001, where he managed and sold the Adknowledge product across Europe. Prior to Engage, Rob was director of Internet research at NOP, where he pioneered the use of online interviewing in the U.K. and in Europe.

Many moons ago, Rob worked stints in automotive engineering, retail design, and video research.
